newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - June 19.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - June 19.

text.p: -- Tobacco settlement talks, which had been dangerously close to collapse, got back on track with the possibility of a deal being reached as soon as Thursday, a key negotiator said. Philip Morris Cos Inc closed at 44-3/4 Wednesday while RJR Nabisco Holdings closed at 34-1/2.
-- Unisys Corp Chairman and Chief Executive James Unruh is expected to resign, the Wall Street Journal said. Unisys closed at seven.

-- A group of institutional shareholders who own 30 to 40 percent of Digital Equipment Corp met in New York to discuss alternatives for the beleaguered company in light of its poor financial and stock performance. Digital finished at 37-3/8.
-- Adobe Systems Inc posted second quarter earnings of $0.54 a share, up from $0.29 a year earlier. Revenues increased about 12 percent. Adobe closed at 40-1/4.

-- Micron Technology Inc said the worldwide rate of growth in sales of personal computer industry systems has declined and may remain below previous growth rates for the foreseeable future. Micron closed at 40-7/8.
